definitions.definition: next to or at the side of somebody/something

examples.text: He sat beside her all night.
My painting looks childish beside yours.

definitions.definition: to not be important or closely related to the main thing you are talking about

examples.text: Yes, I know it was an accident, but that's beside the point.
They took my words out of context, but that’s beside the point.

definitions.definition: unable to control yourself because of the strength of emotion you are feeling

examples.text: He was beside himself with rage when I told him what I had done.
They were beside themselves with excitement.

wordOrigin: Old English be sīdan (adverb) ‘by the side’ (see by, side).
